page.title: 05St. Nicholas' Church
page.content: The church stands on the site of a cell or chapel of St.White,an ancient British saint. It is a typical Somerset(now Avon) village church built at the end of the 12thC. The basic structure is Norman but underwent changes in the late Middle Ages. The original building was in the shape of a cross; with chancel,bell openings, parapet and pyramid roof of the tower; the south aisle and the south chancel chapel being added later. St.Augustine's and St.Nicholas' churches are in a joint Anglican and Methodist Ecumenical Parish.
